name: Customer Service Call Logger
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me organize and track customer service calls and related client interactions.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume each customer can be uniquely identified in the system using a consistent client identifier when I associate calls with clients.
I want to be able to look up an existing client by common attributes such as name or contact details when identifying the client for a call.
I expect the client creator wizard to collect the minimum set of data needed to uniquely distinguish one client from another.
I expect a single call log to be associated with exactly one primary client record rather than multiple clients at once.
I assume that all customer service calls I care about for tracking will be recorded inside this system rather than in separate tools.
I expect open calls and to-do calls to be derived from the same underlying set of call logs rather than from separate tracking lists.
I assume that follow-up steps recorded for a call apply only to that specific call and not globally across multiple calls or clients.
I expect call type options to be chosen from a predefined list of categories that is consistent across the system.
I want the information recorded about a call to include both structured fields and space for free-form notes where needed.
I expect action steps taken during the call to be represented as discrete, individually listed items rather than a single narrative field.
I expect follow-up steps to include an indication of responsibility or ownership so I can see who is expected to act.
I assume additional information about the call is non-mandatory and can be left blank when no extra details are needed.
I want call log reports to include both client-related fields and call-related fields so I can understand the context of each call.
I expect client records created through the wizard to contain the same data elements as client records managed elsewhere in the system.
I assume permission control applies separately to client information and to call logs so that access can differ between these areas.
I want to create a new call log and associate it with a client in a single continuous flow without navigating through multiple unrelated screens.
I expect the system to prompt me to pick or create a client when I start recording a new call if no client is yet associated.
I expect selecting a call type and recording call details to happen within the same interaction session, not as separate processes.
I want to be able to update action steps and follow-up steps for an existing call log after the initial call has been recorded.
I expect my ability to view or edit call logs and client records to depend on my permission level when I access those screens.
I want the client creator wizard to guide me step by step through the required fields without overwhelming me with all fields at once.
I assume I will be able to navigate from a list of open or to-do calls directly to the detailed call log for any selected call.
I expect the light pink page background to be applied uniformly across all main pages of the system.
I expect all visible interface components, including buttons, input fields, and headers, to use the medium violet red color for visual consistency.
I assume that lists of open calls and to-do calls will be presented in a tabular or clearly structured list format rather than as unstructured text.
I want call log reports to be presented in a readable layout that groups related pieces of information for each call.
I expect client information screens to visually distinguish editable fields from read-only data while still using the specified color scheme.

URL: As a user, I want to record customer service calls so that I can manage customer service interactions.
As a user, I want to identify the client for a call so that I can correctly associate the call with the right customer.
As a user, I want to select the call type so that I can categorize the nature of the customer service call.
As a user, I want to record information about the call so that I can capture relevant call details.
As a user, I want to record action steps taken during the call so that I can track what has been done.
As a user, I want to record follow-up steps so that I can ensure necessary actions are completed after the call.
As a user, I want to record additional information about the call so that I can store any extra relevant details.
As a user, I want to create new call logs so that I can document new customer service calls.
As a user, I want to view open calls so that I can see which calls are still active or unresolved.
As a user, I want to view to-do calls so that I can see which calls require further action.
As a user, I want to generate call log reports so that I can review and analyze call history.
As a user, I want to use a client creator wizard so that I can easily create new client records.
As a user, I want to modify client information so that I can keep client details up to date.
As a user, I want permission control to be enforced so that access to the system’s functionality is properly restricted.
As a user, I want the page background set to light pink so that the interface follows the specified design.
As a user, I want all components colored medium violet red so that the system’s visual style matches the requirements.

name: Sales Lead CRM Portal
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me manage and understand my sales leads and customer relationships.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume each lead will have identifiable attributes such as name, contact details, and basic qualification information that I can use to distinguish and manage them.
I want to specify leads individually and also work with subsets of leads based on their shared characteristics or statuses.
I want the system to handle my entire sales pipeline from initial lead capture through different stages of the sales funnel.
I expect the system to support managing a large number of leads without requiring me to track them outside the CRM.
I expect each lead record to store enough detail about interactions and attributes to support meaningful review and follow-up decisions.
I want lead statuses to reflect the key stages in my existing sales process so that progress tracking aligns with how I already work.
I expect lead categories to mirror the way I mentally segment customers, such as by interest level, industry, or source.
I expect reports to include both summary metrics and lead-level details that help me interpret sales performance and activity.
I want best practice advice to be tailored to common CRM usage scenarios rather than generic sales guidance.
I want integration advice to focus on the kinds of tools typically used alongside a CRM, such as email, calendars, and marketing platforms.
I want to browse leads through an interface that lets me quickly scan multiple leads and drill down into an individual lead’s details when needed.
I want to be able to change lead information and status directly from within the lead view without going through a separate administration process.
I expect automated message sending to allow me to configure when and to whom messages are sent, rather than sending messages arbitrarily.
I want configuration options such as settings and dropdown values to be editable through a user-friendly interface, without requiring technical assistance.
I expect advice about best practices and integrations to be accessible from within the CRM interface rather than only from external documentation.
I expect dropdown menus to cover all key categories and statuses I commonly use, so I rarely need to create new options once they are configured.
I expect the reporting capabilities to cover my primary needs for understanding lead activity and sales performance without relying on external tools for basic analysis.
I want the visual style, such as the papaya whip background and dark orange components, to be applied consistently across all pages of the CRM.
I expect the color choices like papaya whip and dark orange to be used in a way that maintains readability and visual clarity of the interface.
I want interface elements such as buttons, menus, and panels to use the defined component color so that the design appears cohesive.

URL: As a user, I want to manage sales leads so that I can effectively handle my customer relationship management activities.
As a user, I want to browse sales leads so that I can review and access lead details easily.
As a user, I want to use automated message sending so that I can communicate with leads efficiently.
As a user, I want to organize leads so that I can keep my sales pipeline structured.
As a user, I want to categorize leads so that I can segment them for better follow-up and analysis.
As a user, I want to update lead information so that I can keep lead data accurate and current.
As a user, I want to update lead status so that I can track their progress through the sales funnel.
As a user, I want to update settings so that I can configure the website according to my preferences.
As a user, I want to update dropdown menus so that I can maintain relevant selection options for leads and reports.
As a user, I want to view reports so that I can understand sales performance and lead activity.
As a user, I want to receive best practice advice so that I can optimize how I use the CRM.
As a user, I want to receive integration advice so that I can connect the CRM with other tools I use.
As a user, I want the background defined as papaya whip so that the website has the specified visual style.
As a user, I want components defined with dark orange so that the interface elements follow the required design.

name: Customer Support Chatbot
initial_requirements: I need a system that can help website visitors get assistance and information through automated conversations.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume that the chatbot will recognize my queries written in natural language without requiring strict commands or specific keywords.
I assume that the chatbot will understand product-related terms such as product names, variants, or categories that I type into the chat.
I expect the chatbot to handle the full end-to-end flow of a typical support interaction within the website, without sending me to external channels.
I expect the chatbot to cover both general customer support questions and product-related questions within the same conversation.
I expect the chatbot to support the entire ordering process, from selecting items to confirming an order, within the chat on the website.
I assume that only website visitors, not external users, will interact with the chatbot, and that all interactions occur within the website context.
I expect the chatbot to use the same product catalog information that is shown on the website so that product details are consistent.
I expect answers to frequently asked questions to be concise and directly address the question without unrelated information.
I expect product information returned by the chatbot to include key attributes such as price, basic specifications, and availability when relevant.
I expect the chatbot to provide only website-relevant assistance and not respond with information unrelated to the site’s products or support topics.
I prefer to stay within a single continuous chat session rather than being forced to start a new conversation for each new question.
I expect the chatbot to guide me step by step through the order completion process instead of asking for all information at once.
I prefer that the chatbot responds quickly to my messages so that the conversation feels like a real-time chat.
I expect to be able to ask follow-up questions about a previous answer without having to restate all details.
I expect the chat interface to be visually integrated into the website layout rather than opening in a separate browser window.
I assume that the snow-colored background will be applied to the main website page behind the chat interface and other components.
I assume that dim gray styling will be applied consistently to interactive components such as buttons, input fields, and chat bubbles to maintain a coherent color scheme.
I expect the contrast between the snow-colored background and the dim gray components to be sufficient for easy readability.
I expect the chatbot messages and my messages to be clearly distinguishable within the chat interface, while still following the overall color scheme.

URL: As a user, I want to interact with a customer support chatbot on the website so that I can receive customer support and handle my interactions online.
As a user, I want the chatbot to answer frequently asked questions so that I can quickly get answers to common issues.
As a user, I want the chatbot to provide product information so that I can learn more about the products I am interested in.
As a user, I want the chatbot to assist me in completing orders so that I can successfully place my purchases.
As a user, I want to interact with the chatbot through a chat interface so that I can easily get the information and help I need.
As a user, I want the website to have a snow-colored background so that the visual styling matches the intended design.
As a user, I want the website components to be styled in dim gray so that the interface components follow the specified color scheme.

name: Insurance Business Automation System
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me manage and analyze my insurance business operations.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume each customer, policy, and claim will be identifiable through unique identifiers that I can use to locate the correct records.
I want to be able to locate customer, policy, and claim records using common business attributes such as names, policy numbers, or claim numbers rather than only technical IDs.
I expect the system to store all customer, policy, and claim information that is necessary for day‑to‑day insurance business operations in a single place.
I expect that customer, policy, and claim data in the system will be interrelated so that I can navigate between these entities without leaving the application.
I assume the system will handle both current and historical customer, policy, and claim records so that analyses and reports can cover past periods.
I expect that the data analysis and reporting capabilities will operate over all data stored in the system rather than being confined to a subset of records.
I expect customer information to include basic identification, contact details, and other key attributes typically used in an insurance context.
I expect policy information to include core policy attributes such as coverage details, dates, premiums, and status that are needed for business review.
I expect claim information to include claim status, amounts, relevant dates, and associated parties so that I can understand the claim situation at a glance.
I want data analysis capabilities to be based on existing customer, policy, and claim data without requiring external data sources.
I expect generated reports to include commonly needed business breakdowns such as by time period, product type, and customer segments.
I assume charts will be based on key business metrics that are meaningful for the insurance domain, such as counts, totals, and trends over time.
I want to navigate between browsing customers, policies, and claims through straightforward, menu‑driven options within the web application.
I expect browsing of customers, policies, and claims to support paging or similar mechanisms so I can handle large volumes of records without being overwhelmed.
I expect to be able to filter or narrow down customer, policy, and claim lists so that I can quickly focus on relevant records during browsing.
I expect the operations I can perform on customer, policy, and claim records to be accessible from the same screens where I browse their details.
I want access to data analysis, report generation, and chart viewing to be available through simple actions from within the same web interface I use for browsing records.
I expect report generation to be initiated on demand by me rather than occurring automatically without my request.
I assume I will be able to choose parameters such as date ranges or business categories when invoking analyses or reports.
I expect customer, policy, and claim details to be presented in a structured, tabular or form‑like layout that is easy to scan.
I expect lists of customers, policies, and claims to be visually distinguishable with clear headings and columns for key attributes.
I assume charts will be embedded directly in the web pages rather than requiring me to open external tools to visualize the data.
I want charts and reports to follow the same whitesmoke background and dark cyan color scheme as the rest of the application for a consistent look.
I expect the whitesmoke background to apply to all main pages where I browse data, run analyses, view reports, and view charts.
I expect dark cyan to be used consistently for key visual elements such as headings, buttons, and chart accents to reinforce the chosen theme.

URL: As a user, I want to browse customer information so that I can view customer details within the insurance business.
As a user, I want to browse policy information so that I can review insurance policies managed by the system.
As a user, I want to browse claims information so that I can review insurance claims managed by the system.
As a user, I want to perform corresponding operations on customer information so that I can manage customer records in the insurance business.
As a user, I want to perform corresponding operations on policy information so that I can manage insurance policies effectively.
As a user, I want to perform corresponding operations on claims information so that I can manage insurance claims efficiently.
As a user, I want to access data analysis capabilities so that I can analyze insurance business data.
As a user, I want to generate various reports so that I can obtain structured information about the insurance business.
As a user, I want to view charts generated by the system so that I can visualize insurance business data.
As a user, I want the web application to apply a whitesmoke background theme so that the interface appearance is consistent with the specified design.
As a user, I want the web application to use dark cyan for elements so that the visual theme matches the required color scheme.

name: Online Polls Platform
initial_requirements: I need a system that lets people participate in polls and see how others have voted.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect each poll to present its voting options as clearly labeled choices that I can distinguish from one another at a glance.
I want to be able to recognize which option I have currently selected before I submit my vote.
I expect to participate in one poll at a time, with my choices limited to the options defined for that specific poll.
I assume I can vote in any poll that is visible to me without needing special permissions.
I assume each poll will allow me to cast a single vote per participation so that my choice is counted once.
I want each poll to show all available options before I decide which one to vote for.
I want the voting results to show the relative distribution of votes per option rather than just a single winning option.
I expect the results view to include the names or labels of options alongside their vote counts or proportions.
I want to browse available options for a poll without being required to vote immediately.
I want the action of casting a vote to be a deliberate step, such as clicking a confirm or submit control, rather than happening automatically when I select an option.
I expect to be able to return to the poll after voting in order to view the updated results.
I prefer to interact with the poll through standard web controls such as buttons or clickable options rather than through text commands.
I want the white background to be applied uniformly across the main page area where polls and results are displayed.
I expect navy component styles to be used consistently for interactive elements such as buttons, selected options, and key interface sections.
I want the contrast between the navy components and the white background to make the poll options and results easy to read.
I expect the overall layout to remain simple and uncluttered so that the focus stays on the poll options and results.

URL: As a user, I want to browse different voting options so that I can decide which option to vote for.
As a user, I want to cast votes for selected options so that I can express my choice in the poll.
As a user, I want to view voting results so that I can see how others have voted.
As a user, I want the website background colored white so that the interface appears clean and consistent.
As a user, I want component styles set to navy so that the visual elements are clearly distinguishable and themed.

name: Promotion Sharing Community
initial_requirements: I need a system where people can share and discover promotions and discounts in one place.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect users to identify promotions primarily by entering or selecting basic details such as title, description, and where the promotion is valid.
I expect users to specify promotions in terms of discounts or deals that are currently active rather than historical offers.
I expect promotions to be associated with a location or store context so that users can understand where the promotion applies.
I assume that users will identify specific promotions of interest by keywords such as brand, product category, or store name.
I intend the system to focus specifically on promotions and discounts rather than general product reviews or price comparisons.
I assume the community website is the primary access channel for sharing and discovering promotions, rather than native mobile apps.
I expect the promotion-sharing functionality to be available to all registered users without special roles beyond admin.
I expect the admin management backend to be limited to administrative users and not visible to regular users browsing promotions.
I want promotions to include essential details such as validity period, conditions, and discount value so they are useful to others.
I expect shared promotions to be user-generated content rather than being automatically imported from external sources.
I expect the system to distinguish between different types of promotions, such as coupons, sales, and promo codes, when they are shared.
I assume that the management backend lets admins view key information about users and promotions sufficient to decide on moderation actions.
I expect users to interact with the system primarily through standard website interactions such as clicking links, buttons, and form submissions.
I assume that browsing promotions will involve navigating through lists or collections of promotions rather than a single static page.
I expect the search capability to be available from the main website interface where users browse and share promotions.
I expect admins to access the management backend through a separate administrative area distinct from the public promotion pages.
I assume that only authenticated admins can perform actions such as adding, editing, or removing users and promotions in the backend.
I expect regular users to be able to submit new promotions via a straightforward input form rather than through complex workflows.
I want the community website to be presented as a cohesive single site where browsing, searching, and sharing promotions occur in the same visual environment.
I expect the ivory outer layout color to be consistently applied to the main page background or frame across the website.
I expect forest green UI blocks to be used for key interface elements such as cards, panels, or sections that contain promotions or controls.
I assume that the color scheme using ivory and forest green is intended to be a core part of the visual identity and should not vary between pages.
I expect promotions to be displayed in a structured layout, such as cards or list items, making it easy to scan multiple deals at once.
I expect the admin management backend to follow the same basic color scheme so that it visually aligns with the main website.

URL: As a user, I want to browse promotions so that I can discover available promotions and discounts.
As a user, I want to share promotions so that I can contribute promotions and discounts to the community.
As a user, I want to search for promotions of interest so that I can quickly find relevant promotions and discounts.
As a user, I want to use a community website for sharing promotions and discounts so that I can engage with others around deals.
As a user, I want the website to have ivory as the outer layout color so that the overall appearance matches the specified design.
As a user, I want the website to use forest green for UI blocks so that the interface elements follow the intended color scheme.
As an admin, I want a management backend for managing users so that I can administer user accounts on the website.
As an admin, I want a management backend for managing promotions so that I can oversee and moderate shared promotions.
As an admin, I want a management backend for managing website settings so that I can configure how the website operates.

name: Fishing Contest Hub
initial_requirements: I need a system to help people discover and engage with fishing contests.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume that I will identify specific fishing contests primarily by their names, dates, or locations when browsing or registering.
I expect to be able to select a particular contest from a list in order to view its detailed information, results, announcements, and photos.
I expect the system to cover both upcoming and past fishing contests rather than only future events.
I assume that browsing contest information includes access to high‑level details such as schedule, location, and basic participation info, not just a contest title.
I expect that contest results will be available for all completed contests that are listed in the system.
I assume that contest announcements and updates are specific to individual contests rather than being generic site‑wide notices.
I expect that showcased photos will be limited to images associated with the fishing contests and not unrelated imagery.
I expect contest information to include enough detail for me to decide whether I want to register, such as dates, eligibility, and general rules.
I want contest results to include at least participant names and their rankings or scores rather than only a winner’s name.
I expect contest announcements to include both initial contest details and subsequent updates such as changes or reminders.
I want showcased contest photos to focus on key moments like catches, award ceremonies, and on‑site scenes that highlight the event atmosphere.
I expect the registration view to display essential information about the selected contest so I can confirm I am registering for the correct event.
I expect to initiate contest registration directly from within the contest’s information or details view.
I prefer to navigate to contest results, announcements, and photos through clear options associated with each specific contest.
I expect browsing contest information, viewing results, announcements, and photos to be possible without requiring complex search actions.
I prefer that switching between contest information, results, announcements, and photos for a single contest requires minimal navigation steps.
I expect upcoming and past contests to be visually distinguishable when I browse them.
I assume that contest results will be presented in an organized list or table so that performances are easy to compare.
I prefer contest announcements to be displayed in chronological order so that the latest updates are easy to identify.
I expect showcased contest photos to be presented in a gallery‑like layout rather than as isolated, unstructured images.
I expect the mint cream background color to apply consistently across the main pages of the website.
I assume that primary interface elements such as buttons, navigation items, and key interactive components will use the teal color to maintain the chosen theme.
I prefer the mint cream and teal color combination to be used in a way that keeps text and important information easily readable.

URL: As a user, I want to browse fishing contest information so that I can learn about upcoming and past contests.
As a user, I want to register for fishing contests so that I can participate in the events.
As a user, I want to view contest results so that I can see how participants performed.
As a user, I want to view posted contest announcements so that I can stay informed about contest details and updates.
As a user, I want to view showcased contest photos so that I can see highlights from the fishing contests.
As a user, I want the website’s primary background to be mint cream so that the overall appearance matches the intended design.
As a user, I want the website’s elements to be teal so that the interface has a consistent color theme.

name: Community Forum Portal
initial_requirements: I need an online forum where I can participate in discussions and manage my own activity.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I want to identify posts primarily by their textual content, such as titles and body text, when browsing and searching.
I expect to specify search targets using simple text keywords rather than complex query syntax.
I want to identify categories by human-readable names that reflect the main topics of the forum.
I expect browsing posts to include content from all categories unless I explicitly filter by a specific category.
I want the search function to operate over all publicly accessible posts in the forum by default.
I want the user center to show only my own activity and information, not activity of other users.
I expect the list of my posts and replies in the user center to cover my full historical activity, not just recent items.
I want each post I browse to show enough context, such as its title, main content, and basic metadata, for me to understand it without extra steps.
I expect search results to show a brief summary or snippet of each matching post so I can judge its relevance quickly.
I want categories to be visible when viewing posts so I can understand the topical context of each discussion.
I expect my user center to include a consolidated view of my authored posts as distinct items rather than mixing them with replies.
I expect my reply records in the user center to show which posts they belong to so I can easily return to those discussions.
I want my personal information section to display core account details such as my username and any profile attributes I have provided.
I want to navigate between general browsing, category-based browsing, search, and my user center through clearly accessible controls within the forum interface.
I expect creating a new post to be initiated from the browsing interface without needing to leave the forum context.
I want replying to a post to be possible directly from the post view where I am reading the discussion.
I want access to the user center to be available from anywhere in the forum through a consistent entry point such as a profile or account area.
I expect moving from my activity lists in the user center to the corresponding posts or replies to be possible with a simple action such as clicking.
I want browsed posts to be presented in a list or feed format that allows me to scan multiple posts quickly.
I expect search results to be presented in a similar list format to normal browsing so the experience feels consistent.
I want posts grouped by category to be visually distinguished from posts in other categories when I choose a specific category to browse.
I want my posts and my replies in the user center to be shown in separate sections or views so I can focus on one type of activity at a time.
I expect my personal information in the user center to be displayed in a clearly labeled section that is visually distinct from my activity lists.

URL: As a user, I want to browse posts so that I can read the content shared in the forum.
As a user, I want to search for posts so that I can quickly find information I am interested in.
As a user, I want to create new posts so that I can share my own topics and questions.
As a user, I want to reply to others' posts so that I can participate in discussions.
As a user, I want to browse posts by category so that I can focus on topics that interest me.
As a user, I want to access a user center so that I can manage my personal forum-related information.
As a user, I want to view my own posts in the user center so that I can review what I have shared.
As a user, I want to view my reply records in the user center so that I can track my participation in discussions.
As a user, I want to view my personal information in the user center so that I can see my account details.

name: Technical Knowledge Hub
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps me access and share technical information and solutions with other users.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to identify technical content of interest using keywords or short text queries rather than needing to provide detailed metadata.
I expect to locate technical articles by navigating through topical categories or tags that reflect common technical domains.
I expect the system to cover a broad range of technical topics rather than focusing on a single technology or product.
I expect the system to provide both general technical explanations and specific issue-resolution solutions rather than only one of these.
I expect that the solutions available in the system address practical, real-world technical issues that users commonly encounter.
I want technical articles to include enough detail to understand underlying concepts, not just high-level summaries.
I want solutions to include step-by-step guidance or clear procedures rather than only describing the final outcome.
I want technical information to reference the specific technologies, tools, or environments involved so I can judge relevance to my situation.
I expect technical articles and solutions to be associated with descriptive titles that help me quickly judge their relevance.
I expect the system to distinguish between general informational articles and concrete problem-solution content so I can choose what I need.
I want to initiate searches on my own whenever I need information rather than relying on the system to push content to me.
I expect to be able to move back and forth easily between browsing lists of articles and viewing the details of a specific article or solution.
I want communication with other users to be text-based so that I can ask questions, provide clarifications, and respond asynchronously.
I expect that discussion with other users will be organized around specific technical topics or solutions rather than being completely unstructured.
I expect to be able to start a new discussion or reply to existing discussions when communicating with other users.
I want search results and article lists to be presented in a way that highlights the most relevant technical content first.
I expect each technical article or solution to be displayed on a dedicated page or view where I can read the full content without distraction.
I want communication threads with other users to be displayed in a chronological or conversation-oriented format that is easy to follow.
I expect technical articles, solutions, and discussions to be visually distinguishable so I can immediately recognize the type of content I am viewing.

URL: As a user, I want to browse technical articles so that I can access relevant technical content.
As a user, I want to search technical information so that I can quickly find the technical topics I need.
As a user, I want to view solutions so that I can learn how to resolve technical issues.
As a user, I want to communicate with other users so that I can discuss technical information and solutions.

name: Anonymous Campus Forum
initial_requirements: I need a platform where students can safely and anonymously communicate and discuss campus-related topics.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume that I will not be required to provide personally identifiable information in public-facing parts of the platform when creating posts or replies.
I prefer to identify relevant discussions using simple text-based keywords when searching for posts.
I expect to identify topics of interest by selecting from visible topic labels or categories associated with posts.
I assume the platform will be limited to campus-related and student-relevant topics rather than general public discussions.
I expect that discussions will primarily involve students from a specific campus or institution rather than a broad global audience.
I assume that the forum structure will organize discussions into distinct threads so that conversations remain focused on particular subjects.
I expect that the search function will operate over all publicly visible posts and replies within the platform.
I expect posts and replies to be primarily text-based, allowing me to express detailed thoughts and ideas.
I prefer that each post clearly shows its associated topic or category so I can quickly understand what the discussion is about.
I expect notifications to include enough context, such as the discussion title or topic, to recognize why I am being notified.
I assume that I will be able to see the chronological order of posts and replies so I can follow the flow of the discussion.
I prefer to create new posts and replies through simple text input fields that are easy to access from the main forum view.
I expect to be able to navigate from a list of posts into a detailed view of an individual discussion thread with its replies.
I assume that following a topic or interest area will be done via a simple action such as clicking a follow or subscribe control.
I prefer that enabling or disabling notifications can be controlled by me, for example by following or unfollowing topics or threads.
I expect that replying to a post will be possible directly from within the thread view without navigating to a separate page.
I prefer that posts be displayed in a list or feed format that allows me to quickly skim multiple discussions.
I expect that search results will be presented as a list of matching posts or threads with key details visible at a glance.
I prefer that followed topics and related discussions be visually distinguishable so I can easily see what I am tracking.
I expect notifications to be presented in a centralized section of the platform, such as a notifications panel or list.
I assume that the platform will not display my real name or personal profile details alongside my posts and replies.

URL: As a user, I want an anonymous campus discussion platform so that I can communicate and discuss with other students without revealing my identity.
As a user, I want a discussion forum feature so that I can participate in structured discussions with other students.
As a user, I want to anonymously post on the forum so that I can share my thoughts without exposing my personal identity.
As a user, I want to reply to posts so that I can engage in conversations and contribute to ongoing discussions.
As a user, I want to participate in discussions so that I can exchange ideas and interact with other students.
As a user, I want to browse posts so that I can easily view existing discussions on the platform.
As a user, I want to search posts so that I can quickly find discussions relevant to my interests.
As a user, I want to follow topics of interest so that I can keep track of discussions that matter to me.
As a user, I want to receive notifications so that I can stay updated on new posts or replies related to my interests.
As a user, I want the platform to ensure my privacy and security so that my personal information is protected.

name: Whistleblower Awareness Hub
initial_requirements: I need a platform where people can safely share and explore hidden truths about business and society.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I want to identify content related to business and society primarily through user‑provided text such as titles, bodies of posts, and tags.
I want to specify what I am looking for using free‑text keywords rather than having to choose from a fixed list of options.
I want to be able to categorize my submissions and discussion posts with topics or tags that help others discover them.
I want the platform to focus on content specifically about business and society rather than covering all possible subject areas.
I expect the anonymous reporting feature and the discussion forum to be available to all registered users, not limited to a small subset.
I expect the news and blog section to include only information relevant to hidden truths or whistleblower content about business and society.
I want to include both narrative descriptions and supporting evidence when submitting insights about hidden truths.
I expect the platform to distinguish between original whistleblower reports, forum discussions, and curated news or blog articles.
I want the latest news and articles to be ordered chronologically so that the most recent items appear first.
I expect search results to include matches from whistleblower reports, forum posts, and news or blog articles in one place.
I want to see enough context in search results and listings, such as a title and short excerpt, to decide what to open.
I want to submit whistleblower insights without having to provide personally identifiable information during the submission step.
I want to interact in the discussion forum using a pseudonym or handle instead of my real name.
I want to navigate between the anonymous reporting feature, discussion forum, and news section through clear menu options.
I expect search to be accessible from any main page so that I can quickly look up topics while browsing.
I want to read forum posts and news articles without being forced to interact or post anything myself.
I want the azure background color to be consistently applied across all major pages of the platform.
I want midnight blue styling to be used for primary UI components such as navigation bars, buttons, and headers.
I want the overall color scheme of azure and midnight blue to provide sufficient contrast so that text and controls are easy to read.
I expect the layout of the discussion forum, search results, and news section to be visually consistent with the chosen color theme.

name: Q&A Helper Site
initial_requirements: I need a system where I can get answers to questions I submit.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume that I will identify questions primarily through a textual title or body that I type into the website.
I expect to identify which answer I am rating by selecting it directly from the list of answers shown for a specific question.
I assume that all submitted questions, answers, and ratings are associated with a single website rather than multiple separate platforms.
I expect that any user who can submit a question can also view answers and rate them within the same account or usage context.
I expect that questions will accept free-form text so I can phrase them in my own words without strict formatting constraints.
I assume that each answer consists primarily of text so that information or help can be expressed in detail.
I expect that when I view answers for a question, I will see all answers that have been submitted for that question, not just a single response.
I assume that answer ratings are stored per answer so that each answer has its own evaluative indication of helpfulness.
I expect that answer ratings reflect feedback from multiple users rather than only my own opinion.
I expect to submit questions through an on-page form or input field without needing to leave the website or use external tools.
I assume that answering a question involves an explicit action, such as clicking a control to start composing an answer for that specific question.
I expect that rating an answer is performed using a simple control such as a clickable scale or button, rather than a complex review process.
I assume that after I submit a question or an answer, the website will display it back to me so I can confirm what was recorded.
I expect that when I view answers, I can navigate back to the list of questions or to other questions without losing my place on the website.
I assume that the beige background color applies consistently across all pages where I submit questions, view answers, and rate them.
I expect that saddle brown is used for key interface components such as headers, buttons, or panels so that these elements stand out against the beige background.
I assume that the overall color scheme of beige background with saddle brown components will remain consistent across different parts of the website.
I expect that questions, answers, and rating controls are visually distinguishable from one another while still following the beige and saddle brown theme.

name: Real Estate Finder

I expect to specify my property preferences using common real estate attributes such as price range, property type, and number of rooms when filtering.

I assume the system will cover multiple properties at once rather than showing only a single featured property.
I expect search and filter options to apply to the entire set of available listings, not just a small predefined subset.
I expect the property listings to be continuously discoverable, allowing me to browse through many options instead of a fixed limited sample.
I expect each property listing to include core information such as price, location, and basic property type at a glance.
I expect the detailed property view to show more comprehensive information than the basic listing, such as size, features, and description.
I expect the website to only show real estate related information and not unrelated content when I am exploring properties.
I expect to interact with the system through a standard website interface using mouse or touch to navigate, click, and scroll.
I expect to refine my search iteratively by adjusting filters and search terms without having to restart my browsing session.
I expect search and filter actions to update the visible list of properties without requiring me to manually reload the page.
I assume the property listings will be presented in a structured, easily scannable layout such as a list or grid.
I expect property details to be presented in a dedicated view or section that is visually distinct from the listings overview.
I want the alice blue background color to be consistently applied across all pages of the website, including listing and detail views.

name: Crypto Escrow Platform
initial_requirements: I need a system that enables me to carry out secure cryptocurrency transactions with other users.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to identify specific cryptocurrency products primarily by attributes such as cryptocurrency type, quantity, and price when browsing and selecting sellers’ offerings.
I assume that sellers and buyers will be distinguishable within the system so that I can clearly see which listings belong to which seller identity.
I expect to specify which cryptocurrency I am depositing into escrow by selecting it directly from my chosen product or wallet balance within the system.
I assume that transactions arranged through the system will be fully handled within the system from initiation to completion, without requiring me to coordinate any steps externally.
I expect the escrow mechanism to apply to both buying and selling scenarios so that any transaction involving cryptocurrency can be protected by escrow within the system.
I expect the system to maintain a historical record of all my completed and ongoing transactions rather than only showing my most recent activity.
I assume that only transactions created through the system will appear in my transaction records and be manageable there.
I expect sellers’ cryptocurrency product listings to include key details such as price, available amount, and cryptocurrency type to let me judge suitability before initiating a transaction.
I want transaction confirmations to include essential information such as the parties involved, cryptocurrency type, quantity, total cost, and escrow status so I can verify correctness.
I expect transaction records to show enough detail, such as date, status, and amounts, to let me understand what happened in each transaction without needing to open external sources.
I expect the dispute resolution functionality to allow me to reference specific transactions and provide relevant information or evidence related to that transaction.
I assume that managing my cryptocurrency products as a seller will involve specifying details such as price and quantity when adding or updating listings.
I expect to initiate a transaction directly from a selected cryptocurrency product listing rather than having to re-enter product details manually.
I expect the process of depositing cryptocurrency into escrow to be part of the guided transaction flow, rather than a completely separate standalone operation.
I expect transaction confirmation to be presented as an explicit step in the transaction flow that I can review before finalizing the transaction.
I assume that the release of cryptocurrency from escrow will be triggered by an explicit user action or a clearly indicated system event once conditions are met.
I expect to access dispute resolution options from within the context of a specific transaction rather than searching for a general dispute interface elsewhere.
I expect managing my transaction records as a seller to involve actions like updating descriptive notes or organizing views rather than altering the actual financial outcomes.
I assume that adding, updating, or removing my cryptocurrency products will be done through interactive forms or controls directly tied to each product entry.
I expect the initialized light gray background color to be applied consistently across the main interface so that all screens have a uniform base appearance.
I expect the initialized dark red component color to be used consistently for primary interface elements such as buttons or key highlights so that they stand out visually.
I assume that buyers’ and sellers’ views will use the same overall visual theme so that the experience feels coherent across different roles.
I expect transaction confirmations and transaction records to be presented in a clear, structured layout where important information is visually emphasized.

URL: As a user, I want to browse sellers' cryptocurrency products so that I can find suitable cryptocurrency to purchase.
As a user, I want to select sellers' cryptocurrency products so that I can initiate a cryptocurrency transaction.
As a user, I want to conduct cryptocurrency transactions through the system so that I can securely buy or sell cryptocurrency.
As a user, I want to deposit cryptocurrencies into an escrow account so that my funds are held securely during the transaction process.
As a user, I want the system to provide transaction confirmation so that I can verify that my transaction details are correct and accepted.
As a user, I want the system to release cryptocurrency from escrow so that the cryptocurrency is transferred when transaction conditions are met.
As a user, I want access to dispute resolution functionality so that I can resolve issues that arise during a transaction.

As a user, I want the component color initialized with dark red so that the interface components are visually distinct.

As a seller, I want to manage my cryptocurrency products so that I can add, update, or remove items I am selling.

As a seller, I want to manage my transaction records so that I can keep my transaction information organized.

name: Multi-State Price Comparator
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me find and compare product prices across different states.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to identify products primarily by category and other simple parameters rather than by complex product codes.
I assume I can specify which states I want to include in the search instead of always searching all states.
I expect to be able to enter a product name or keyword in addition to choosing categories to narrow down the search.
I intend to compare prices for the same product or equivalent products across multiple states at the same point in time.
I assume the system will allow me to limit the search to a subset of states rather than requiring a nationwide search.
I expect to be able to restrict results to products that match all of my selected parameters rather than just some of them.
I assume that when I look for the lowest-priced products, the system will consider only items that meet my specified categories and parameters.
I expect that the product quantity shown will correspond to a standard unit or package size used for comparison across states.
I expect product prices to be directly comparable across states without manually adjusting for packaging differences.
I assume supplier information will at least identify the supplier name and location for each product.
I expect detailed product information to include a clear product identifier such as a name or model that lets me recognize the item.
I expect the quantity information to indicate the unit of measurement or package size in addition to the numeric quantity.
I assume that price information will clearly indicate the currency being used for all states.
I expect supplier information to be associated with each listed price so I can see which supplier is offering a specific price.
I expect to control the product search through filters and selections rather than needing to perform multiple separate searches manually.
I assume that when I change selected product categories or parameters, the system will automatically update the search results.
I expect to be able to sort search results by price so that the lowest-priced products appear first when I look for cost-effective options.
I expect to open or expand a product entry to see detailed information such as price, quantity, and supplier without leaving the main comparison view.
I assume the system will allow me to switch between a broad comparison view and a more detailed view of an individual product.
I expect the system to present prices from different states in a single comparative view so that I can easily evaluate differences.
I assume the interface will visually distinguish products and states so I can quickly see which price belongs to which state.
I expect detailed product information to be presented in a structured format where price, quantity, and supplier details are clearly labeled.
I expect the comparison view to align products in a way that makes it obvious when I am looking at the same product across multiple states.
I assume that the lowest-priced options will be visually highlighted or easily recognizable in the comparison results.

As a user, I want to compare product prices across different states so that I can evaluate price differences between locations.
As a user, I want to select specific product categories so that I can focus my search on relevant types of products.
As a user, I want to select specific parameters so that I can refine and control the scope of the product search.
As a user, I want to find the lowest-priced products so that I can identify the most cost-effective options.
As a user, I want to view detailed product information including price so that I can understand the cost of each product.
As a user, I want to view detailed product information including quantity so that I know how much of the product is available or included.
As a user, I want to view detailed product information including supplier information so that I know who is providing the product.

name: Custom Shirt Shop
initial_requirements: I need a system that lets customers design and purchase personalized shirts online.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume I will identify a shirt model by selecting from a predefined list of available styles rather than typing a free-form description.
I assume I will choose a fabric from a catalog of supported materials rather than entering arbitrary fabric names.
I expect the system to ask for my body measurements using clearly labeled measurement fields such as chest, waist, sleeve length, and shirt length.
I only expect the system to support shirt products and do not require customization of other garment types.
I expect one customized shirt design to be generated per configuration session based on the set of inputs I provide at that time.
I assume that customizing a shirt is limited to choosing model, fabric, and measurements rather than altering the fundamental shirt construction.
I expect the generated shirt design to visually reflect all of my selected options such as model, fabric, and size-related measurements.
I expect the shirt design preview to be informative enough that I can verify whether my selections have been applied correctly.
I expect the order handling process to be tied directly to the specific design I previously confirmed without requiring me to re-enter design details.
I expect to customize a shirt by providing inputs in a guided sequence rather than through an open-ended design canvas.
I expect to have an explicit action, such as clicking a button, to trigger confirmation of the finalized shirt design before ordering.
I expect that once I confirm a shirt design, the system will treat that design as locked for the subsequent order and payment steps unless I explicitly go back to edit it.
I expect the payment step to occur after my design and order details are finalized, not before.
I expect the shirt design preview to be presented visually in a way that resembles a realistic representation of the final shirt rather than just textual attributes.
I expect the floral white background color to be applied consistently across all main screens of the customization and purchasing process.
I expect the dark goldenrod UI elements to be used consistently for primary interactive components such as buttons, menus, and key controls.
I assume that the floral white background and dark goldenrod UI elements are chosen to keep the interface visually simple and uncluttered while customizing the shirt.

name: Short-Term Apartment Rental Platform
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps me find and rent short-term apartments that fit my needs.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to be able to specify my apartment needs using common attributes such as location, dates, price range, and number of guests.
I expect apartment types to be identified using familiar categories such as studio, one-bedroom, or two-bedroom rather than technical or internal codes.
I only want to see apartments that are available for short-term stays rather than long-term leases.
I expect the apartment options presented to be limited to properties that can be booked directly through this system.
I expect each apartment listing to show enough descriptive information for me to judge whether it might fit my needs before opening its details.
I expect apartment details to include information relevant to short stays, such as nightly rate, availability dates, and included amenities.
I expect my booking records to include key information such as dates, apartment identity, and total cost so I can recognize each reservation at a glance.
I expect browsing, searching, and filtering apartments to be accessible from a common interface without needing to switch to different applications.
I expect to be able to move smoothly from a list of apartments to an individual apartment’s details and then to the booking action without losing my place.
I expect that once I complete a booking, it will automatically appear in my booking records without requiring manual entry.
I expect the linen screen background color or texture to be applied consistently across all website pages, including browsing, search results, apartment details, and booking records.
I expect maroon highlights to be used consistently for key interactive components such as buttons, selected filters, and important status indicators.
I prefer that the linen background and maroon highlights be combined in a way that keeps text and apartment information easy to read.
I expect the overall visual design, including the linen background and maroon highlights, to remain the same across different devices and screen sizes.

name: Domain Leasing Platform
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps me rent and manage domain names online.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume I will identify domains primarily by entering a domain name or keyword string into a search field.
I expect to distinguish domains using standard attributes such as full domain name, extension (TLD), and possibly a short description.
I only intend to lease domains through this system, not to purchase domains outright.
I expect the system to handle multiple domains under a single user account rather than restricting me to a single domain.
I expect domain transfers to be restricted to domains that are already managed within this system.
I assume the system will manage lease lifecycles from initial lease through renewal and eventual expiration.
I expect domain information to include basic lease-related attributes such as lease start date, expiration date, and current status.
I want domain information to include ownership or account association details so I can see who currently controls the domain.
I expect leasing records to show historical actions such as initial leasing, renewals, and transfers for my domains.
I expect leasing records to be tied to my user account so I can see only my own leasing history.
I expect user management to include basic profile data such as name, contact information, and login credentials.
I expect order management to group related lease, renewal, and transfer actions into discrete orders with identifiers I can reference.
I expect payment management to associate each payment with the corresponding order or lease action for traceability.
I expect payment management to retain a history of my past payments for reference and reconciliation.
I expect to perform searching, leasing, renewing, and transferring operations through a web-based user interface rather than offline channels.
I expect that actions like lease, renewal, and transfer will be performed through step-by-step forms that guide me through required inputs.
I expect to access user management, order management, and payment management from within a single authenticated account area.
I expect to navigate between domain information, leasing records, orders, and payments using clear menu or navigation links.
I want the old lace background color to be applied consistently across all main pages of the website, including management and detail views.
I want rosy brown to be used consistently for interactive component details such as buttons, borders, or key interface elements rather than for general background areas.
I expect textual information such as domain details, leasing records, and payment information to remain clearly readable against the old lace background and rosy brown components.
I expect the visual style using old lace and rosy brown to be applied uniformly so that different sections of the site do not appear visually disjointed.

name: Leadership Consulting Portal
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps clients discover and engage with my leadership and business training services online.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect the website to serve as the primary online channel through which clients discover, evaluate, and engage with my leadership and business training services.
I expect the system to cover the full client journey from initial discovery of my services through to online purchase and participation in selected offerings.
I assume users will locate specific services by navigating labeled sections such as workshops, online classes, podcasts, and blogs rather than by entering free-form search queries only.
I assume users will identify services they want to purchase based on the service titles and descriptions presented on service listing or detail pages.
I expect each service offering to include enough descriptive information for users to understand its focus, target audience, and relevance to leadership and business skills.
I expect workshop information to include practical details such as schedule, duration, and format so that users can make attendance decisions.
I expect online classes to be accessible through the website without requiring users to navigate to an unrelated third-party site manually.
I expect podcasts and blogs on the site to focus specifically on leadership and business topics that support and complement my training services.
I expect the website’s informational content and purchasable services to be clearly connected so that users can move from learning about a topic to purchasing a related service.
I intend the e-commerce component to support purchasing both one-time events like workshops and ongoing offerings like classes or programs.
I expect users to be able to complete an entire purchase workflow on the website without needing to contact me separately to finalize the transaction.
I assume users will primarily interact with the system through standard web navigation elements such as menus, buttons, and links.
I expect users to be able to move easily between browsing content (blogs, podcasts) and exploring purchasable services during a single visit.
I want the overall visual style of the site to be consistent across all pages so that users perceive the website as a unified experience.
I expect interactive interface elements such as buttons, navigation menus, and other components to share a common cadet blue color to visually signal their interactive nature.
I expect the light cyan background to apply to both content pages and e-commerce-related pages so that the shopping experience feels integrated with the rest of the site.
I want the chosen colors and layout to support a professional yet approachable brand image appropriate for leadership and business training.
I intend the website to host both informational resources and actual training delivery for remote users via online classes and podcasts.
I expect users to be able to start consuming free content such as blogs and podcasts without needing to complete a purchase first.
I expect blogs and podcasts to be organized in a way that allows users to browse multiple entries and select items of interest based on titles or summaries.

name: Online Trading Platform
initial_requirements: I need a system that allows me to participate in and manage my online trading activities.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I want to identify items I bid on using information such as item titles, brief descriptions, images, and unique identifiers presented on the website.
I want to specify which item I am placing an order for by selecting it directly from a listing or detail page rather than entering an item identifier manually.
I want my trading account to be identified by a personal login so that my bids, orders, and history are clearly associated with me.
I want to be able to participate in multiple trading activities (bidding, browsing, ordering, and account management) within the same website rather than using separate systems.
I want the website to support both buying and selling actions when I place orders, not just one side of the trade.
I want my trading history to cover all past bids, orders, and completed transactions that I have made through the website.
I want to be able to manage all key aspects of my trading account information and settings from a single account management area.
I want trading opportunities to include enough detail about each item or offer, such as price and basic attributes, for me to decide whether I am interested.
I want my trading history to show essential details for each transaction, such as the item, date, and transaction type, so I can understand my past activity.
I want the account management area to show my current contact details, preferences, and trading-related settings so that I can review and adjust them.
I want to be able to browse trading opportunities before deciding whether to bid or place an order on any particular item.
I want to initiate bids and orders through clear actions such as buttons or links on the item or offer pages.
I want to navigate easily between browsing opportunities, bidding, placing orders, viewing history, and managing my account without having to leave the website.
I want the lemon chiffon background color to be applied consistently across all main pages of the website, including trading, history, and account management screens.
I want the chocolate component color to be applied consistently to interactive elements such as buttons, menus, and key interface components throughout the website.
I want the lemon chiffon background and chocolate component colors to provide enough visual contrast so that the interface remains easily readable.

name: Email Sending Platform
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me easily create and send messages to my contacts.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume that my existing contacts are identified primarily by their email addresses.
I expect to be able to identify recipients by selecting them from my saved contact list rather than always typing email addresses manually.
I expect to be able to specify multiple recipients for a single email.
I intend to use this system only for sending emails and not for other communication channels like SMS or chat.
I expect that messages created and sent through this system will be stored within the system for later review.
I assume that managing recipients is limited to the contacts I store in this system and does not automatically synchronize with external address books unless explicitly configured.
I expect to include a subject line and body text as distinct parts of each email I compose.
I expect to be able to format the email body text beyond plain text, such as using paragraphs and basic text styling.
I assume that templates will contain predefined subject lines and body text that I can reuse and modify.
I expect that uploaded attachments will be associated with a specific email and included when that email is sent.
I expect to be able to compose, select recipients, attach files, and send the email from a single, integrated workflow.
I expect to be able to modify the list of recipients and the email content up until the moment I trigger the send action.
I want to be able to create, update, and delete templates through straightforward actions without needing technical skills.
I expect to add, edit, and remove recipients in my contact list through simple management actions.
I expect to initiate sending with an explicit action, such as clicking a send button, so emails are not sent automatically without my confirmation.
I expect sent emails to be presented in a list that I can browse through to review what I have already sent.
I expect each sent email entry to display key details such as recipient(s), subject, and send time at a glance.
I expect my recipient list to be organized in a way that makes it easy to find and select individual contacts, such as by name.
I expect templates to be presented in a list or catalog that allows me to quickly choose the one I want when composing an email.

URL: As a user, I want to compose emails so that I can create the email content I want to send.
As a user, I want to select recipients so that I can choose who will receive my emails.
As a user, I want to send emails so that I can deliver my messages to the selected recipients.
As a user, I want to manage sent emails so that I can organize and review emails I have already sent.
As a user, I want to use email templates so that I can quickly compose standard or repeated email content.
As a user, I want to upload attachments so that I can include files with my emails.
As a user, I want to manage recipients so that I can maintain and organize my list of email recipients.
